quote: The single biggest problem in communication is the illusion that it has taken place.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: We have two ears and one mouth so that we can listen twice as much as we speak.
author: Epictetus

quote: Wise men speak because they have something to say; Fools because they have to say something.
author: Unknown

quote: Words are singularly the most powerful force available to humanity. We can choose to use this force constructively with words of encouragement, or destructively using words of despair. Words have energy and power with the ability to help, to heal, to hinder, to hurt, to harm, to humiliate and to humble.
author: Yehuda Berg

quote: If you can't convince them, confuse them.
author: Harry S Truman

quote: Half the world is composed of people who have something to say and can't, and the other half who have nothing to say and keep on saying it.
author: Robert Frost

quote: I do not agree with what you have to say, but I'll defend to the death your right to say it.
author: Evelyn Beatrice Hall

quote: I think it's very important to have a feedback loop, where you're constantly thinking about what you've done and how you could be doing it better. I think that's the single best piece of advice: constantly think about how you could be doing things better and questioning yourself.
author: Elon Musk

quote: Communication leads to community, that is, to understanding, intimacy and mutual valuing.
author: Rollo May

quote: Eloquence is a painting of the thoughts.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Communication - the human connection - is the key to personal and career success.
author: Paul J. Meyer

quote: Of all of our inventions for mass communication, pictures still speak the most universally understood language.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Talk low, talk slow and don't say too much.
author: John Wayne

quote: If you have an important point to make, don't try to be subtle or clever. Use a pile driver. Hit the point once. Then come back and hit it again. Then hit it a third time - a tremendous whack.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: The most important thing in communication is hearing what isn't said.
author: Peter Drucker

quote: Communication is a skill that you can learn. It's like riding a bicycle or typing. If you're willing to work at it, you can rapidly improve the quality of evry part of your life.
author: Brian Tracy

quote: The ability to simplify means to eliminate the unnecessary so that the necessary may speak.
author: Hans Hofmann

quote: It usually takes me more than three weeks to prepare a good impromptu speech.
author: Mark Twain

quote: To effectively communicate, we must realize that we are all different in the way we perceive the world and use this understanding as a guide to our communication with others.
author: Tony Robbins

quote: Good communication is just as stimulating as black coffee, and just as hard to sleep after.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: The basic tool for the manipulation of reality is the manipulation of words. If you can control the meaning of words, you can control the people who must use the words.
author: Philip K. Dick

quote: The two words 'information' and 'communication' are often used interchangeably, but they signify quite different things. Information is giving out; communication is getting through.
author: Sydney J. Harris

quote: Truthful words are not beautiful; beautiful words are not truthful. Good words are not persuasive; persuasive words are not good.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: The game of life is a game of boomerangs. Our thoughts, deeds and words return to us sooner or later with astounding accuracy.
author: Florence Scovel Shinn

quote: A different language is a different vision of life.
author: Federico Fellini

quote: Whatever words we utter should be chosen with care for people will hear them and be influenced by them for good or ill.
author: Buddha

quote: The pen is the tongue of the mind.
author: Horace

quote: Don't tell me the moon is shining; show me the glint of light on broken glass.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: Be still when you have nothing to say; when genuine passion moves you, say what you've got to say, and say it hot.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: My belief is that communication is the best way to create strong relationships.
author: Jada Pinkett Smith

quote: Blessed is the man, who having nothing to say, abstains from giving wordy evidence of the fact.
author: George Eliot

quote: Any problem, big or small, within a family, always seems to start with bad communication. Someone isn't listening.
author: Emma Thompson

quote: Words are, of course, the most powerful drug used by mankind.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: Metaphors have a way of holding the most truth in the least space.
author: Orson Scott Card

quote: Number one, cash is king... number two, communicate... number three, buy or bury the competition.
author: Jack Welch

quote: Words are all we have.
author: Samuel Beckett

quote: Take advantage of every opportunity to practice your communication skills so that when important occasions arise, you will have the gift, the style, the sharpness, the clarity, and the emotions to affect other people.
author: Jim Rohn

quote: Good words are worth much, and cost little.
author: George Herbert

quote: Electric communication will never be a substitute for the face of someone who with their soul encourages another person to be brave and true.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: The more we elaborate our means of communication, the less we communicate.
author: J. B. Priestley

quote: Words - so innocent and powerless as they are, as standing in a dictionary, how potent for good and evil they become in the hands of one who knows how to combine them.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: The speed of communications is wondrous to behold. It is also true that speed can multiply the distribution of information that we know to be untrue.
author: Edward R. Murrow

quote: Genius is the ability to put into effect what is on your mind.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: Everything becomes a little different as soon as it is spoken out loud.
author: Hermann Hesse

quote: Brevity is the soul of wit.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Journalism is literature in a hurry.
author: Matthew Arnold

quote: Writing, to me, is simply thinking through my fingers.
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: Speak clearly, if you speak at all; carve every word before you let it fall.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

quote: By and large, language is a tool for concealing the truth.
author: George Carlin

quote: The art of writing is the art of discovering what you believe.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: You can change your world by changing your words... Remember, death and life are in the power of the tongue.
author: Joel Osteen

quote: To hold a pen is to be at war.
author: Voltaire

quote: There is only one rule for being a good talker - learn to listen.
author: Christopher Morley

quote: I have noticed that nothing I never said ever did me any harm.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: Language exerts hidden power, like the moon on the tides.
author: Rita Mae Brown

quote: Quote me as saying I was mis-quoted.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: Oaths are but words, and words are but wind.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Science may never come up with a better office communication system than the coffee break.
author: Earl Wilson

quote: Words, once they are printed, have a life of their own.
author: Carol Burnett

quote: It is not the voice that commands the story; it is the ear.
author: Italo Calvino
